EEG signal decomposition using Independent Component Analysis (ICA)

Source: R/ica.R
eeg_ica.Rd

EEG signal decomposition using Independent Component Analysis (ICA)

eeg_ica(.data, ...)

# S3 method for eeg_lst
eeg_ica(.data, ..., method = fICA::adapt_fICA,
  config = list(), tolerance = 1e-06, max_iterations = 1000)

Arguments

.data

An eeg_lst object
...

Channels to include in ICA transformation. All the channels by default, but eye channels and reference channels should be removed.
method

Methods from different packages: fICA::adapt_fICA (default), fICA::fICA, fICA::reloaded_fICA, fastICA::fastICA, or a custom function that returns a list that contains S (reconstucted sources) and A (mixing matrix), consistent with the formulation X=A %*% S or W (unmixing matrix), consistent with the formulation X %*% W = S (i.e., W == solve(X)).
config

Other parameters passed in a list to the ICA method. These are the default parameters except that when possible the method is run in C rather than in R. See the documentation of the relevant method.
tolerance

Convergence tolerance.
max_iterations

Maximum number of iterations.

Value

An ica_lst object

Contents

  • Arguments
  • Value
